docs.title: Welcome to the E-commerce Project Documentation
docs.text:
This documentation provides an overview of the e-commerce project, including installation instructions, usage guidelines, and API details.

Use the navigation on the left to explore the documentation.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are welcome! Please follow these steps:

  1. Fork the repository.
  2. Create a new branch for your feature or bugfix.
  3. Make your changes.
  4. Submit a pull request.

Please ensure your code follows the project's coding standards and includes tests where applicable.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Follow these steps to set up the project:

  1. Clone the repository: 
    git clone https://github.com/2arry/ecommerce_project.git
  2. Navigate to the project directory: 
    cd ecommerce_project
  3. Install the dependencies: 
    pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. Apply migrations: 
    python manage.py migrate
  5. Run the development server: 
    python manage.py runserver

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
• Access the admin panel at /admin/
  • Use the API endpoints for orders, payments, and authentication

docs.title: Admin Panel
docs.text: The admin panel allows you to manage users, orders, and payments.

docs.title: Endpoints
docs.text:
• POST /api/auth/login/ - Log in a user
  • POST /api/auth/register/ - Register a new user
  • POST /api/auth/logout/ - Log out a user

docs.title: Endpoints
docs.text:
• GET /api/orders/ - List all orders
  • POST /api/orders/ - Create a new order
  • GET /api/orders/{id}/ - Retrieve an order by ID
  • PUT /api/orders/{id}/ - Update an order by ID
  • DELETE /api/orders/{id}/ - Delete an order by ID

docs.title: Endpoints
docs.text:
• GET /api/payments/ - List all payments
  • POST /api/payments/ - Create a new payment
  • GET /api/payments/{id}/ - Retrieve a payment by ID
  • PUT /api/payments/{id}/ - Update a payment by ID
  • DELETE /api/payments/{id}/ - Delete a payment by ID
